thread.title: Activists occupy Baltimore City Hall; oppose commissioner
thread.title_full: Activists occupy Baltimore City Hall; oppose commissioner

title: Activists occupy Baltimore City Hall; oppose commissioner
text:
Activists opposed to new Baltimore police commissioner's appointment occupy City Hall 
By JULIET LINDERMAN Published: 10/14/15 10:20 pm EDT - Updated: 10/14/15 10:20 pm EDT 
BALTIMORE â€” Activists opposed to the permanent appointment of Baltimore's interim police commissioner have occupied City Hall. 
Members of the Baltimore Bloc began shouting from the upper gallery of a conference room Wednesday night as a city council subcommittee voted to make Kevin Davis the permanent commissioner. The protesters then refused to leave. 
Police spokesman T.J. Smith says less than 50 protesters are inside and police are "monitoring the situation." 
A spokesman for the protesters has said they won't leave until Davis and the mayor agree to a list of demands. 
Davis was appointed interim chief to replace Anthony Batts . The full council still has to vote on his permanent appointment. 
Batts was fired due to a skyrocketing homicide rate in Baltimore following the death of Freddie Gray from injuries received in police custody. The city erupted in riots following Gray's death in April.
